title: New Year celebrations Highlights: India welcomes 2025 with multi-city festivities - Hindustan Times
summary:
India Celebrates New Year 2025 with Festivities Across Major Cities

Publication Date: December 31, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Communities worldwide have kicked off celebrations for 2025, with India deploying extensive security measures as festive activities take place in major cities.

  • Delhi Police has deployed nearly 20,000 personnel and set up traffic restrictions around popular areas like Connaught Place.
  • Mumbai's New Year’s Eve festivities will see over 14,000 police personnel ensuring safety across major locations.
  • Bengaluru is ramping up security with over 7,500 CCTV cameras and increased police presence.
  • Events across India include fireworks, public gatherings, and significant traffic arrangements to manage celebrations.
“We have prepared a comprehensive arrangement to ensure the safety and security of all residents and visitors during the upcoming New Year's Eve celebrations.” - Deputy Commissioner of Police, New Delhi

As cities across India celebrate New Year 2025, significant attention is being given to safety, with authorities ensuring that events are conducted securely and peacefully.
newTitle: India Celebrates New Year 2025 with Festivities Across Major Cities

title: Who was Debrina Kawam? Woman burned to death in NYC subway train identified - Hindustan Times
summary:
Who was Debrina Kawam? Woman burned to death in NYC subway train identified

Date: Dec 31, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A 61-year-old woman was tragically identified as the victim of a horrific subway attack in New York City. Debrina Kawam was set on fire while reportedly sleeping on the train.

  • The attack occurred on December 22 when Kawam was on a Brooklyn F train.
  • Sebastian Zapeta-Calil, a Guatemalan immigrant, has been arrested and charged with first-degree murder in connection with the attack.
  • Despite severe injuries, her identification was aided by her fingerprints.
  • Witnesses did not intervene, and video footage shows Zapeta-Calil observing the incident from a distance.
  • Kawam was believed to be homeless, carrying many personal belongings at the time.
“Indifferent as ever, the presumed killer is seen watching the victim succumb to her fate from a bench on the platform.”

This tragedy has sparked outrage and highlighted issues regarding homelessness and safety in public transit.
newTitle: Identity of NYC Subway Arson Victim Debrina Kawam Revealed

title: Heartbreaking Last Photo Of Boy, 3, Youngest Victim Killed In South Korea Plane Crash - News18
summary:
Heartbreaking Last Photo Of Boy, 3, Youngest Victim Killed In South Korea Plane Crash

Date: December 31, 2024 Source: News18

A devastating final photo emerged of the three-year-old boy who was killed in the South Korean plane crash alongside his parents. Kang Ko, his wife Jin Lee Seon, and their son were tragically lost in the Jeju Air Boeing 737-800 crash while attempting an emergency landing at Muan International Airport.

  • The plane crash claimed 179 lives on December 31, 2024.
  • The boy was on his first trip abroad for Christmas.
  • Kang Ko worked in public relations for the Kia Tigers baseball team.
  • Two flight attendants were the only survivors among the 181 people onboard.
  • Authorities are investigating the crash.
“He was so good at his job that everyone on our company’s baseball broadcasting team liked him.” - Jung Woo-young

This tragic event highlights the fragility of life and the deep impact such incidents have on families and communities.
newTitle: Heartbreaking Last Photo Of Boy, 3, Youngest Victim Killed In South Korea Plane Crash

title: Puerto Rico’s power grid collapses, leaving island in the dark - DAWN.com
summary:
Puerto Rico Faces Widespread Power Outage on New Year’s Eve

Publication Date: New Year’s Eve

Source: LUMA Energy

Puerto Ricans were left without electricity early on New Year’s Eve due to a grid failure affecting nearly the entire island.

  • Approximately 90% of clients lost power on Tuesday morning at 9:30 AM (6:30 PST).
  • Restoration of power is expected to take 24 to 48 hours, pending conditions.
  • The cause of the outage is under investigation, with preliminary findings suggesting a failure in an underground line.
  • Governor Pedro Pierluisi has called for accountability from energy providers.
  • Puerto Rico has a history of frequent power outages, exacerbated by past infrastructure issues and Hurricane Maria.
“This is a major incident,” said Ivan Baez, spokesperson for power generator Genera.

Residents are urged to stay informed as efforts continue to restore power across the island.
newTitle: Puerto Rico Faces Widespread Power Outage on New Year’s Eve

title: Blinkit delivers ‘7x more’ grapes on New Year's Eve as Indians go crazy for viral ‘12 grapes’ tradition - Hindustan Times
"No One Can Stop...": China's Xi Jinping Ends 2024 With A Threat To Taiwan - NDTV
summary:
Xi Jinping Issues Strong Warning to Taiwan as 2024 Approaches

Publication Date: New Year’s Eve

Source: New Delhi

Chinese President Xi Jinping ended the year with a firm statement regarding Taiwan, asserting that "no one can stop the reunification" with China. His address highlights the ongoing tensions between Beijing and Taipei amidst military escalations.

  • President Xi emphasized the notion of blood ties between Chinese people on both sides of the Taiwan Strait.
  • Recent military drills have been conducted by China, aimed at applying pressure on Taiwan, especially post-elections.
  • The US views Taiwan as a key strategic ally, complicating the relationship between Beijing and Washington.
  • Xijinping's threats are particularly significant as they come just before Donald Trump’s inauguration as US President.
“Chinese people on both sides of the Taiwan Strait are one family. No one can sever our blood ties.” - Xi Jinping

In conclusion, Xi's declarations signal a potential escalation in tensions in the coming year, as China remains steadfast in its claims over Taiwan.
newTitle: Xi Jinping Issues Strong Warning to Taiwan as 2024 Approaches

title: 10 best New Year’s traditions to celebrate the start of 2025 - The Times of India
summary:
10 Best New Year’s Traditions to Celebrate the Start of 2025

Publication Date: Dec 31, 2024 | Source: Times of India

The New Year is just around the corner, and it’s time to embrace traditions that make this celebration truly special. Whether you love a big party or prefer a quiet, meaningful start, these 10 ideas will help you kick off 2025 in the best way!

  • Family and friends reunions to cherish quality time.
  • Creating vibrant rangoli patterns believed to bring positivity.
  • Dressing in new clothes as a refreshing start.
  • Participating in pujas and prayers for peace and blessings.
  • Indulging in traditional New Year's meals.
  • Celebrating local festivals and fairs to bond with the community.
  • Holding movie marathons for relaxation after festivities.
  • Making visits and giving gifts to loved ones to share joy.
  • Writing down resolutions and reflections for a purposeful year.
  • Enjoying fireworks to welcome the new year with excitement.

Explainer: What happens when Russian gas supply to Europe via Ukraine ends? - Reuters.com
Explainer: What happens when Russian gas supply to Europe via Ukraine ends? - Reuters
summary:
Explainer: What Happens When Russian Gas Supply to Europe via Ukraine Ends?

Date: Dec 31, 2023 Source: Reuters

Russian gas supplies through Ukraine, which have been in place for over 40 years, are set to end on January 1, 2024, following Ukraine's refusal to renew a transit deal with Gazprom. This marks a significant shift in Europe's energy landscape amid ongoing geopolitical tensions.

  • Ukraine's Naftogaz will not renew its five-year transit deal with Gazprom, halting supplies that amount to millions of cubic meters.
  • Since the onset of the Ukraine conflict, the EU’s dependency on Russian gas has dramatically declined, with market share dropping from 35% to about 8%.
  • The European Commission believes that current demands can be met through alternative sources like LNG and non-Russian pipeline imports.
  • Countries such as Austria and Slovakia will feel the impact, with Austria heavily reliant on gas from Ukraine.
  • Slovakia has secured alternative supply contracts with companies like BP and Eni to mitigate the effects of the loss.
“Gazprom plans to suspend supply to Moldova on Jan. 1 citing unpaid bills.”

In conclusion, the cessation of Russian gas transit via Ukraine not only affects immediate energy supplies but also highlights a crucial turning point for European energy security.
newTitle: Explainer: What Happens When Russian Gas Supply to Europe via Ukraine Ends?

title: Mount Ibu in Indonesia erupts, prompting flight alert - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Mount Ibu in Indonesia erupts, prompting flight alert

Date: December 31 Source: Greater Kashmir

Mount Ibu, located in Indonesia’s North Maluku province, erupted earlier on Tuesday, prompting an aviation warning, the country’s Volcanology and Geological Disaster Mitigation Centre reported.

The biggest eruption occurred at 5:18 a.m. local time, sending a column of ash up to three km into the sky. Residents living near the slopes of the mountain are prohibited from engaging in any activities within a four-km radius of the crater.

  • The eruption sent ash clouds drifting southeast and east of the volcano.
  • Mount Ibu is currently at the second-highest alert level.
  • Residents are advised to wear facemasks and sunglasses during volcanic ash fall.
  • An orange level aviation warning restricts flights within five km of the volcano.
  • Mount Ibu is one of Indonesia’s 127 active volcanoes.
“A total of 21,100 eruptions were recorded from the volcano in 2023, making it the second most active volcano in Indonesia.”

The recent activities of Mount Ibu are part of a series of eruptions from various volcanoes in Indonesia, which is located on the Pacific 'Ring of Fire'.
newTitle: Mount Ibu in Indonesia erupts, prompting flight alert

title: Recap 2024: Top-10 Global Crisis World Saw in Year 2024 - Adda247
A deadly December for aviation: At least 7 plane crashes, hundreds dead - Business Standard
summary:
A Deadly December for Aviation: At Least 7 Plane Crashes, Hundreds Dead

Published on: December 2024

Source: Major News Outlet

A string of devastating aviation disasters in December 2024 has left hundreds dead and shaken public confidence in air travel safety. The incidents include mechanical failures, challenging weather conditions, and external interference, igniting intense scrutiny of aviation safety protocols.

Key Points

  • Over 170 people died in the Jeju Air crash in South Korea on December 28.
  • Azerbaijan Airlines experienced a crash on December 25, resulting in 38 fatalities.
  • Private plane crashes in Brazil killed 10 members of a family.
  • Multiple other crashes occurred in Papua New Guinea, Hawaii, Brazil, Argentina, and Scotland.
  • Numerous non-fatal incidents underline the urgent need for improved aviation safety protocols.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“The month of December 2024 marks one of the deadliest periods in aviation history.”

The events echo those of July 2014, one of the most catastrophic months for commercial aviation.

Conclusion

The aviation industry is facing increasing pressure to enhance safety measures to prevent further tragedies and restore public confidence.
newTitle: A Deadly December for Aviation: At Least 7 Plane Crashes, Hundreds Dead

title: 5 notable New Year traditions from around the world - The Indian Express
summary:
5 Notable New Year Traditions from Around the World

Publication Date: December 1, 2024 Source: Indian Express

New Year celebrations occur globally, each culture celebrating in unique ways. This article explores five notable traditions.

  • Spain: People eat 12 grapes at midnight for good luck.
  • Greece: Onions are hung on doors for fertility and good health, accompanied by the cutting of a luck cake.
  • Japan: Celebrations include ringing bells 108 times and eating soba noodles for good fortune.
  • Germany: The tradition of Bleigießen, or lead pouring, predicts future luck and prosperity.
  • Scotland: 'First Footing' determines the incoming year's luck, marked by cleaning homes and singing 'Auld Lang Syne'.
“The ideal 'First Footer' is a tall, dark-haired man, as superstition suggests that fair-haired visitors bring misfortune.”

These diverse customs reflect the rich tapestry of New Year celebrations across cultures, each symbolizing hope and renewal for the year ahead.
newTitle: 5 Notable New Year Traditions from Around the World
